dublinCore.dc:title: 114 S323 IS: Responsible Use of Taxpayer Dollars for Portraits Act of 2015

form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mrs. Shaheen introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs

form.official-title: To prohibit the use of Federal funds for the costs of official portraits of Members of Congress, heads of executive agencies, and heads of agencies and offices of the legislative branch.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Responsible Use of Taxpayer Dollars for Portraits Act of 2015.

section.header: Prohibition on use of funds for official portraits

paragraph.text: the term executive agency has the meaning given the term in section 133 of title 41, United States Code;
the term Member of Congress includes a Delegate or Resident Commissioner to Congress; and
the term portrait means a painting.
Except as provided in paragraph (2), no Federal funds may be used to pay for the production of a portrait of—

subparagraph.text: the head of an executive agency; or
the head of an agency or office of the legislative branch.

paragraph.header: Individuals in line of succession to presidency
paragraph.text: Not more than $20,000 in Federal funds may be used to pay for the production of a portrait of an individual who is in the line of succession to the presidency under subsection (a), (b), or (d) of section 19 of title 3, United States Code.

subsection.text: Nothing in this Act shall be construed to prohibit—

paragraph.text: the use of Federal funds to publicly display a portrait of an individual described in subsection (b)(1); or

the use of funds other than Federal funds to produce a portrait of an individual described in subsection (b)(1), including, in the case of a portrait of an individual described in subsection (b)(2), the use of funds other than Federal funds to pay the entire cost of producing the portrait or the portion of the cost that exceeds $20,000, if any.
